abstract.text: Customize the document browser’s look and behavior.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You can set the browser’s appearance, create document thumbnails, and modify the browser’s behavior.
Change the browser’s appearance by setting the
property. The document browser view controller supports white, light, and dark appearances.

The system automatically provides thumbnails or icons for supported document types. If your app uses a custom or third-party document type, you can create a Thumbnail extension for that type. For more information, see

If you don’t provide a Thumbnail extension, the system can create a document icon based on your app icon. To enable automatic icon creation, go to the Project navigator, choose the target, click Info, and then do the following:
Declare support for the document’s UTI in the Document Type section.
For any custom document types that you create, export the UTI in the Exported UTIs section.
For any third-party document types used by your app, import the UTI in the Imported UTIs section.
For more information, see
Your app’s icon only appears in the Files app or document browser when the following are all true:
The system doesn’t automatically provide a thumbnail for the UTI.
The system doesn’t already provide an icon for the UTI.
The user hasn’t installed a Thumbnail extension for the UTI.
Your app both declares document type support for the UTI and declares the UTI as an exported or imported type.
The system automatically provides previews for supported document types. If your app uses a custom or third-party document type, you can create a Preview extension for that type.
For more information, see
You can control the following behaviors:
The type of documents the browser opens
Whether the browser opens multiple files at the same time
Whether the browser creates new documents
You set the list of allowed document types when you create the browser. Pass an array of uniform type identifier (UTI) strings to the
class’s
method. If you pass
, the browser uses the document types specified by the
key in the app’s
file.
For detailed instructions on setting the
key, see
The following example programmatically creates a document browser for

By default, users can select only one item at a time. To enable multiple document selection, set the document browser’s
property to
To let users create new documents, you must do the following:
Set the browser’s

Implement the

After these steps are completed, the system automatically includes an Add button (+) in the document browser’s navigation bar.
When the user taps the Add button, the system calls the
method. In your implementation, you can present a custom user interface, where users can configure the document. For example, you might show a list of document templates.
Create a new document and save it to a temporary location. As soon as the document is saved, call the provided
. To confirm the request, pass in the document’s temporary URL and the import mode (
or

abstract.text: The document types supported by the bundle.
An abstract base class for creating thumbnails of custom file types.
An expression to evalutate if a conditional expression’s predicate evaluates to true.
Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A view controller for browsing and performing actions on documents that you store locally and in the cloud.
A mode indicating that the file should be copied into its new location (the original file is left unchanged).
A mode indicating that the file should be moved to its new location (the original file should be deleted).
A mode indicating that the document can’t be imported.
A Boolean value that determines whether the document browser can create new documents.
A Boolean value that determines whether the user can select and open more than one document at a time.
The visual style for the document browser.
Initializes and returns a document browser view controller that can open the specified file types.
The protocol you implement to respond as the user interacts with the document browser.
Asks the delegate to create a new document.
Give users access to their local or remote documents from within your app.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adding a document browser to your app

abstract.text: Add custom document browser actions, activities, and bar items.
Manage your interface using view controllers and facilitate navigation around your app’s content.
